alert.note: Alert for Thurston (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 05 at 7:28AM PST until December 07 at 11:21PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: .Heavy rain overnight and another round this morning as the front passes through and to the south of the advisory area is causing urban and small stream nuisance flooding. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Washington, including the following counties, in northwest Washington, Grays Harbor and Kitsap. In west central Washington, King, Lewis, Pierce, Snohomish and Thurston. * WHEN...Until 130 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 728 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
